unnormalised: **Automotive: EV Charging Gets a Desi Boost!**
normalised: **Automotive: Electric Vehicle Charging Gets a Desi Boost!**

unnormalised: Hey petrolheads (and electrich-heads!), big news from the EV charging scene! IIT Madras just unveiled a super cool, fast-charging tech that could juice up your Tata Nexon in like, half the time. Forget those endless waits at the charging stations; we’re talking almost chai-break charging speed!
normalised: Hey petrolheads (and electric-heads!), big news from the electric vehicle charging scene! I I T Madras just unveiled a super cool, fast-charging tech that could juice up your Tata Nexon in like, half the time. Forget those endless waits at the charging stations; we’re talking almost chai-break charging speed!

unnormalised: Speaking of which, imagine road-tripping down to Kerala for Onam and actually *enjoying* the scenic route instead of stressing about range anxiety. This new tech promises extended range and faster charging cycles, making those long drives less of a hassle.
normalised: Speaking of which, imagine road-tripping down to Kerala for Onam and actually *enjoying* the scenic route instead of stressing about range anxiety. This new tech promises extended range and faster charging cycles, making those long drives less of a hassle.

unnormalised: Rumor has it, several companies are already lining up to integrate this into their upcoming models. Maybe by Diwali, we’ll be seeing EV charging kiosks popping up faster than biryani stalls on a Sunday!
normalised: Rumor has it, several companies are already lining up to integrate this into their upcoming models. Maybe by Diwali, we’ll be seeing Electric Vehicle charging kiosks popping up faster than biryani stalls on a Sunday!

unnormalised: Expect to see more charging stations in Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities soon, funded by govt. schemes. We're talking charging stations every 50 km on major highways! Experts predict significant reduction in cost of EV charging per unit – possibly down to Rs. 8/unit. Let’s hope this puts the "electric" back in "electrifying" the Indian automotive market!
normalised: Expect to see more charging stations in Tier two and Tier three cities soon, funded by government schemes. We're talking charging stations every fifty kilometer on major highways! Experts predict significant reduction in cost of Electric Vehicle charging per unit – possibly down to rupee eight per unit. Let’s hope this puts the "electric" back in "electrifying" the Indian automotive market!
